formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Formula: d = \sqrt{(x_2 - x_1)^2 + (y_2 - y_1)^2} This is derived from the Pythagorean theorem: the straight-line distance is the hypotenuse of a right triangle whose legs are the differences in x and y.

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: d = 2R \arcsin \left(\sqrt{\sin^2\left(\frac{\varphi_2 - \varphi_1}{2}\right) + \cos(\varphi_1)\cos(\varphi_2)\sin^2\left(\frac{\lambda_2 - \lambda_1}{2}\right)}\right) Where φ is latitude in radians, λ is longitude in radians, and R is Earth’s radius.
